stack.description:
SSH Config for backend nodes and other non-frontend appliances.
We are using one key pair among all SSH servers in the cluster. This implies we do not care about Man-in-the-Middle attacks. We have subverted the protection for these attacks for several releases (broadcastSSH).
This logic should not be in the ssh.xml node so the frontend will generate its own keypair.

stack.post:
key="
/opt/stack/sbin/read-ssh-private-key RSA1 2> /dev/null | python -c ' import base64 import sys base64.encode(sys.stdin, sys.stdout)' "
echo $key | python -c ' import base64 import sys base64.decode(sys.stdin, sys.stdout)' > /etc/ssh/ssh_host_key
chmod 0400 /etc/ssh/ssh_host_key
cat /etc/ssh/ssh_host_key.pub 2> /dev/null
/opt/stack/sbin/read-ssh-private-key DSA 2> /dev/null
cat /etc/ssh/ssh_host_dsa_key.pub 2> /dev/null
